00085 int
00086 execute(char *cmd_line, int quiet)
00087 {
00088     int pid,
00089         status,
00090         rc;
00091 
00092     const char *new_argv[4];
00093     new_argv[0] = "/bin/sh";
00094     new_argv[1] = "-c";
00095     new_argv[2] = cmd_line;
00096     new_argv[3] = NULL;
00097 
00098          pid = safe_fork();
00099          if (pid == 0) {    /* for the child process:         */
00100         /* We don't want to see any errors if quiet flag is on */
00101         if (quiet) close(2);
00102         if (execvp("/bin/sh", (char *const *)new_argv) < 0) {    /* execute the command  */
00103             debug(LOG_ERR, "execvp(): %s", strerror(errno));
00104             exit(1);
00105         }
00106     }
00107          else {        /* for the parent:      */
00108                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Waiting for PID %d to exit", pid);
00109                 rc = waitpid(pid, &status, 0);
00110                 debug(LOG_DEBUG, "Process PID %d exited", rc);
00111     }
00112 
00113     return (WEXITSTATUS(status));
00114 }

00116 struct in_addr *
00117 wd_gethostbyname(const char *name)
00118 {
00119         struct hostent *he;
00120         struct in_addr *h_addr, *in_addr_temp;
00121 
00122         /* XXX Calling function is reponsible for free() */
00123 
00124         h_addr = safe_malloc(sizeof(struct in_addr));
00125         
00126         LOCK_GHBN();
00127 
00128         he = gethostbyname(name);
00129 
00130         if (he == NULL) {
00131                 free(h_addr);
00132                 UNLOCK_GHBN();
00133                 return NULL;
00134         }
00135 
00136         mark_online();
00137 
00138         in_addr_temp = (struct in_addr *)he->h_addr_list[0];
00139         h_addr->s_addr = in_addr_temp->s_addr;
00140         
00141         UNLOCK_GHBN();
00142 
00143         return h_addr;
00144 }

00146 char *get_iface_ip(char *ifname) {
00147 #ifdef __linux__
00148     struct ifreq if_data;
00149 #endif
00150     struct in_addr in;
00151     char *ip_str;
00152     int sockd;
00153     u_int32_t ip;
00154 
00155 #ifdef __linux__
00156     
00157     /* Create a socket */
00158     if ((sockd = socket (AF_INET, SOCK_PACKET, htons(0x8086))) < 0) {
00159         debug(LOG_ERR, "socket(): %s", strerror(errno));
00160         return NULL;
00161     }
00162 
00163     /* Get IP of internal interface */
00164     strcpy (if_data.ifr_name, ifname);
00165 
00166     /* Get the IP address */
00167     if (ioctl (sockd, SIOCGIFADDR, &if_data) < 0) {
00168         debug(LOG_ERR, "ioctl(): SIOCGIFADDR %s", strerror(errno));
00169         return NULL;
00170     }
00171     memcpy ((void *) &ip, (void *) &if_data.ifr_addr.sa_data + 2, 4);
00172     in.s_addr = ip;
00173 
00174     ip_str = (char *)inet_ntoa(in);
00175     return safe_strdup(ip_str);
00176 #else
00177     return safe_strdup("0.0.0.0");
00178 #endif
00179 }

00181 char *get_iface_mac (char *ifname) {
00182 #ifdef __linux__
00183     int r, s;
00184     struct ifreq ifr;
00185     char *hwaddr, mac[13];
00186     
00187     strcpy(ifr.ifr_name, ifname);
00188 
00189     s = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
00190     if (-1 == s) {
00191        debug(LOG_ERR, "get_iface_mac socket: %s", strerror(errno));
00192        return NULL;
00193     }
00194 
00195     r = ioctl(s, SIOCGIFHWADDR, &ifr);
00196     if (r == -1) {
00197        debug(LOG_ERR, "get_iface_mac ioctl(SIOCGIFHWADDR): %s", strerror(errno));
00198        close(s);
00199        return NULL;
00200     }
00201 
00202     hwaddr = ifr.ifr_hwaddr.sa_data;
00203     snprintf(mac, 13, "%02X%02X%02X%02X%02X%02X", 
00204        hwaddr[0] & 0xFF,
00205        hwaddr[1] & 0xFF,
00206        hwaddr[2] & 0xFF,
00207        hwaddr[3] & 0xFF,
00208        hwaddr[4] & 0xFF,
00209        hwaddr[5] & 0xFF
00210        );
00211        
00212     close(s);
00213     return safe_strdup(mac);
00214 #else
00215     return NULL;
00216 #endif
00217 }

00220 #ifdef __linux__
00221     FILE *input;

00223 
00224     device = (char *)malloc(16);

00226 
00227     input = fopen("/proc/net/route", "r");
00228     while (!feof(input)) {
00229         fscanf(input, "%s %s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s %*s\n", device, gw);
00230         if (strcmp(gw, "00000000") == 0) {
00231             free(gw);
00232             return device;
00233         }
00234     }
00235     fclose(input);
00236

00238     free(gw);

00243 void mark_online() {
00244         int before;
00245         int after;
00246 
00247         before = is_online();
00248         time(&last_online_time);
00249         after = is_online();
00250 
00251         if (before != after) {
00252                 debug(LOG_INFO, "ONLINE status became %s", (after ? "ON" : "OFF"));
00253         }

00260

00263         after = is_online();

00274 int is_online() {
00275         if (last_online_time == 0 || (last_offline_time - last_online_time) >= (config_get_config()->checkinterval * 2) ) {
00276                 /* We're probably offline */
00277                 return (0);
00278         }
00279         else {
00280                 /* We're probably online */
00281                 return (1);
00282         }
00283 }

00316 int is_auth_online() {
00317         if (!is_online()) {
00318                 /* If we're not online auth is definately not online :) */
00319                 return (0);
00320         }
00321         else if (last_auth_online_time == 0 || (last_auth_offline_time - last_auth_online_time) >= (config_get_config()->checkinterval * 2) ) {
00322                 /* Auth is  probably offline */
00323                 return (0);
00324         }
00325         else {
00326                 /* Auth is probably online */
00327                 return (1);
00328         }
00329 }

00331 /*
00332  * @return A string containing human-readable status text. MUST BE free()d by caller
00333  */
00334 char * get_status_text() {
00335         char buffer[STATUS_BUF_SIZ];
00336         ssize_t len;
00337         s_config *config;
00338         t_auth_serv *auth_server;
00339         t_client        *first;
00340         int             count;
00341         unsigned long int uptime = 0;
00342         unsigned int days = 0, hours = 0, minutes = 0, seconds = 0;
00343      t_trusted_mac *p;
00344         
00345         len = 0;
00346         snprintf(buffer, (sizeof(buffer) - len), "WiFiDog status\n\n");
00347         len = strlen(buffer);
00348 
00349         uptime = time(NULL) - started_time;
00350         days    = uptime / (24 * 60 * 60);
00351         uptime -= days * (24 * 60 * 60);
00352         hours   = uptime / (60 * 60);
00353         uptime -= hours * (60 * 60);
00354         minutes = uptime / 60;
00355         uptime -= minutes * 60;
00356         seconds = uptime;
00357 
00358         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Version: " VERSION "\n");
00359         len = strlen(buffer);
00360 
00361         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Uptime: %ud %uh %um %us\n", days, hours, minutes, seconds);
00362         len = strlen(buffer);
00363 
00364         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Has been restarted: ");
00365         len = strlen(buffer);
00366         if (restart_orig_pid) {
00367                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "yes (from PID %d)\n", restart_orig_pid);
00368                 len = strlen(buffer);
00369         }
00370         else {
00371                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "no\n");
00372                 len = strlen(buffer);
00373         }
00374         
00375         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Internet Connectivity: %s\n", (is_online() ? "yes" : "no"));
00376         len = strlen(buffer);
00377         
00378         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Auth server reachable: %s\n", (is_auth_online() ? "yes" : "no"));
00379         len = strlen(buffer);
00380 
00381         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "Clients served this session: %lu\n\n", served_this_session);
00382         len = strlen(buffer);
00383 
00384         LOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00385         
00386         first = client_get_first_client();
00387         
00388         if (first == NULL) {
00389                 count = 0;
00390         } else {
00391                 count = 1;
00392                 while (first->next != NULL) {
00393                         first = first->next;
00394                         count++;
00395                 }
00396         }
00397         
00398         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "%d clients "
00399                         "connected.\n", count);
00400         len = strlen(buffer);
00401 
00402         first = client_get_first_client();
00403 
00404         count = 0;
00405         while (first != NULL) {
00406                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "\nClient %d\n", count);
00407                 len = strlen(buffer);
00408 
00409                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "  IP: %s MAC: %s\n", first->ip, first->mac);
00410                 len = strlen(buffer);
00411 
00412                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "  Token: %s\n", first->token);
00413                 len = strlen(buffer);
00414 
00415                 snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "  Downloaded: %llu\n  Uploaded: %llu\n" , first->counters.incoming, first->counters.outgoing);
00416                 len = strlen(buffer);
00417 
00418                 count++;
00419                 first = first->next;
00420         }
00421 
00422         UNLOCK_CLIENT_LIST();
00423 
00424     config = config_get_config();
00425     
00426     if (config->trustedmaclist != NULL) {
00427         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "\nTrusted MAC addresses:\n");
00428         len = strlen(buffer);
00429 
00430         for (p = config->trustedmaclist; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00431             snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "  %s\n", p->mac);
00432             len = strlen(buffer);
00433         }
00434     }
00435 
00436     snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "\nAuthentication servers:\n");
00437     len = strlen(buffer);
00438 
00439     LOCK_CONFIG();
00440 
00441     for (auth_server = config->auth_servers; auth_server != NULL; auth_server = auth_server->next) {
00442         snprintf((buffer + len), (sizeof(buffer) - len), "  Host: %s (%s)\n", auth_server->authserv_hostname, auth_server->last_ip);
00443         len = strlen(buffer);
00444     }
00445 
00446     UNLOCK_CONFIG();
00447 
00448         return safe_strdup(buffer);
00449 }
